On this page

BaseObject â€‹

It is a super base class.

Its subclasses include:

â”œâ”€ Bar.ts 
â”œâ”€ Bars.ts 
â”œâ”€ Box.ts 
â”œâ”€ Boxs.ts 
â”œâ”€ ExtrudeLine.ts 
â”œâ”€ ExtrudeLines.ts 
â”œâ”€ ExtrudeLineTrail.ts 
â”œâ”€ ExtrudePolygon.ts 
â”œâ”€ ExtrudePolygons.ts 
â”œâ”€ FatLine.ts 
â”œâ”€ FatLines.ts 
â”œâ”€ HeatMap.ts 
â”œâ”€ Line.ts 
â”œâ”€ Lines.ts 
â”œâ”€ Model.ts 
â”œâ”€ Path.ts 
â”œâ”€ Paths.ts 
â”œâ”€ Point.ts
â”œâ”€ Points.ts 
â”œâ”€ Terrain.ts

Its API and maptalks Geometry is very similar

constructor() â€‹

Usually, we directly use its subclasses

js
 const baseObject = new BaseObject(id);

methods â€‹

_initOptions(options: Record<string, any>) â€‹

init BaseObject inner config for custom

js
   this._initOptions(options);

_createMesh(geometry, material) â€‹

create inner THREE.Mesh for custom

js
    const geometry = new THREE.CircleBufferGeometry(r, 50);

    //Initialize internal object3d
    // https://github.com/maptalks/maptalks.three/blob/1e45f5238f500225ada1deb09b8bab18c1b52cf2/src/BaseObject.js#L140
    this._createMesh(geometry, material);

_createGroup() â€‹

create inner THREE.Group for custom

_createLine(geometry, material) â€‹

create inner THREE.Line

_createPoints(geometry, material) â€‹

create inner THREE.Points for custom

_createLineSegments(geometry, material) â€‹

create inner THREE.LineSegments for custom

_createInstancedMesh(geometry, material, count) â€‹

create inner THREE.InstancedMesh for custom

getObject3d() â€‹

get inner THREE.Object3d , THREE.Mesh , THREE.Group etc

getOptions() â€‹

get BaseObject options config

addTo(threeLayer) â€‹

hide() â€‹

isVisible():boolean â€‹

setInfoWindow(options) â€‹

js
   // //infowindow test
   bar.setInfoWindow({
       content: 'hello world,height:' + d.height * 400,
       title: 'message',
       animationDuration: 0
   });

getInfoWindow() â€‹

openInfoWindow(coordinate) â€‹

setToolTip(content, options) â€‹

js
   // // tooltip test
   bar.setToolTip(d.height * 400, {
       showTimeout: 0,
       eventsPropagation: true,
       dx: 10
   });

getMinZoom() â€‹

getMaxZoom() â€‹

isAsynchronous() â€‹

Is it asynchronous, that is, constructing graphic data through workers

on(eventName, handler, context) â€‹

js
const clickHandler = (e) => {

}
bar.on('click', clickHandler);

once(eventName, handler, context) â€‹

js
bar.once('click', clickHandler);

off(eventName, handler, context) â€‹

js
bar.off('click', clickHandler);

events â€‹

js
const clickHandler = (e) => {

}
bar.on('click mousemove', clickHandler);

WARNING

This event will only be triggered by constructing graphic data through workers
